result.eng: She starts working at 7.30 in the morning and finishes at 11.00 at night seven days a week.
result.ga: tosaíonn sí ag obair ag 7 30 ar maidin agus críochnaíonn sí ag 11 00 istoíche seacht lá in aghaidh na seachtaine
result.orig: Tosaíonn sí ag obair ag 7 30 ar maidin agus críochnaíonn sí ag 11 00 istoíche seacht lá in aghaidh na seachtaine
result.html: tosaíonn sí ag obair ag 7 30 ar maidin agus críochnaíonn sí ag 11 00 istoíche seacht lá in aghaidh na seachtaineShe starts working at 7.30 in the morning and finishes at 11.00 at night seven days a week.
result.ponchtml: tosaíonn sí ag obair ag 7 30 ar maidin agus críoċnaíonn sí ag 11 00 istoíċe seaċt lá in aġaiḋ na seaċtaineShe starts working at 7.30 in the morning and finishes at 11.00 at night seven days a week.

result.eng: He remembers an incident that happened one day.
result.ga: is cuimhin leis eachtra a tharla lá
result.orig: Is cuimhin leis eachtra a tharla lá
result.html: is cuimhin leis eachtra a tharla láHe remembers an incident that happened one day.
result.ponchtml: is cuiṁin leis eaċtra a ṫarla láHe remembers an incident that happened one day.

result.eng: Very few people in the world remmeber the day of that assassination.
result.ga: is beag duine ar domhan gur cuimhin leis lá an dhúnmharaithe sin

result.ponchtml: is beag duine ar doṁan gur cuiṁin leis lá an ḋúnṁaraiṫe sinVery few people in the world remmeber the day of that assassination.

result.eng: I was preparing for my wedding, which was only eleven days before me.
result.ga: bhí mé ag réitiú do mo bhainis nach raibh ach aon lá déag romham
result.orig: Bhí mé ag réitiú do mo bhainis nach raibh ach aon lá déag romham

result.ponchtml: ḃí mé ag réitiú do mo ḃainis naċ raiḃ aċ aon lá déag roṁamI was preparing for my wedding, which was only eleven days before me.

result.eng: The building collapsed unexpectedly in late afternoon that day.
result.ga: thit an foirgneamh go talamh gan choinne i ndeireadh tráthnóna an lae úid
result.orig: Thit an foirgneamh go talamh gan choinne i ndeireadh tráthnóna an lae úid
result.html: thit an foirgneamh go talamh gan choinne i ndeireadh tráthnóna an lae úidThe building collapsed unexpectedly in late afternoon that day.
result.ponchtml: ṫit an foirgneaṁ go talaṁ gan ċoinne i ndeireaḋ tráṫnóna an lae úidThe building collapsed unexpectedly in late afternoon that day.

result.eng: At the end of the day, though, these accusations cannot be proven.

result.eng: This was done in Shannon Airport where you see thousands of American soldiers every day on their way to Iraq.

result.eng: I was thinking about this recently.

result.eng: Jamie was four years old, no more, no less.

result.eng: How did you spend the day, child?

result.eng: It was the night between the two Days of Christmas.

result.eng: Night turned into day.

result.html: chuaigh an oíche thart go dtáinig an láNight turned into day.
result.ponchtml: ċuaiġ an oíċe ṫart go dtáinig an láNight turned into day.

result.eng: A little later in the day he bought some bread.

result.eng: Don't taste a single drop of that damned beer as long as you live.

result.eng: They took me out of my bed an hour before daybreak.

result.eng: The day I was set free I felt happy.

result.eng: They were a day's walk from the place.

result.eng: I don't have to work a single day for as long as I live. I am rich.
